Description: East Greek terracotta aryballos in the form of a hedgehog; exterior: short neck and narrow mouth; hand-modelled ears, eyes, snout, and legs; painted decoration consisting of spots on body, eyes, and ears.
Curator's comments: Marked '1'(?) with pencil, but obscured by subsequent registration and catalogue numbers.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (1642)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.033) (Phase 3)
Payne 1931 / Necrocorinthia. A study of corinthian art in the archaic period (p. 176, fig. 79)
